content.title: [論点] Duterteと偽善教会 -  Rappler
content.desc: Duterte has repeatedly lambasted Catholic priests. He has called them gay, useless, and corrupt. The message is clear. For President Duterte, the Catholic Church is a hypocritical institution. Thus it has no credibility to call him out for his errors. Is this a case of the pot calling the kettle black? This, in my view, is an important question that needs to be confronted. Duterte has gone largely unscathed by his tirades against the clergy. In a religious society like the Philippines, one might expect that priests have an untouchable place. But Duterte has kept attacking them. To do so has...

content.title: Duterteは、カトリック信者に、メアリーの「無私」をエミュレートするように促す -  SunStar Philippines
content.source_nm: サンスターフィリピン
content.desc: DESPITE his recent tirades against Catholic Church leaders, President Rodrigo Duterte on Saturday, December 8, joined the Catholic faithful in commemorating the Feast of the Immaculate Conception of Mary. Duterte, in a message, called on his fellow Filipinos to emulate Mary's "selflessness." Tweets by sunstaronline He was hopeful that the narrative of Mary's Immaculate Conception would serve as a "constant reminder" of her humility and thoughtfulness when she accepted the invitation to be Christ's mother so that the plan of salvation would be realized. "I join the entire Filipino Catholic C...

content.title: Duterteはミンダナオ島の戒厳令第3拡張を望んでいる -  SunStar Philippines
content.source_nm: サンスターフィリピン
content.desc: PRESIDENT Rodrigo Duterte has sought Congress to extend martial rule in Mindanao for another year, heeding the call of the Armed Forces of the Philippines and the Philippine National Police. "The Palace confirms that the President has requested Congress to approve the further extension of martial law and the suspension of the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus in the whole of Mindanao for another year starting next month," Presidential Spokesperson Salvador Panelo said in a statement, Friday, December 7. READ: Police, military formally recommend martial law extension Duterte has already...

content.title: 権利団体はMindanao  -  Rapplerの別の戒厳法の拡張に反対している
content.desc: CAGAYAN DE ORO CITY, Philippines – The Movement Against Tyranny-Northern Mindanao (MAT-NMR) said it is against the third extension of martial law in Mindanao and condoned the announcement of Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) Chief of Staff General Carlito Galvez Jr regarding this proposal. The martial law currently in effect in Mindanao was supposed to lapse on December 31, after being in place for one year. President Rodrigo Duterte has asked Congress for a third extension . In a statement, MAT-NMR said that the martial law in Mindanao which started on May 24, 2017, at the onset of the...

content.title: デリマ：Revillaの無罪は「間違った信号を送る」 -  Rappler
content.desc: MANILA, Philippines – Detained opposition Senator Leila de Lima on Saturday, December 8, expressed disbelief over the recent decision of the anti-graft court Sandiganbayan to acquit former senator Ramon "Bong" Revilla Jr of plunder charges related to the multi-billion-peso pork barrel scam. De Lima said in a statement sent from her detention cell on Saturday that the verdict was "a sad moment for truth, justice, and accountability" and "sends the wrong signal." "With Revilla’s acquittal, it now appears that legislators are not responsible for how they use their pork, even if this ends up b...

content.title: DabawenyosはLGU関係者に満足している -  SunStar Philippines
content.source_nm: サンスターフィリピン
content.desc: MAJORITY of the Dabawenyos said they are satisfied with the performance of the current local government officials in the city. In the City Wide Social Survey Series 10 (CWSS 10) of the Ateneo de Davao University (AdDu)on Friday, December 7, 89.8 percent of Dabawenyos said that they are “very satisfied” and 7.9 percent are “somewhat satisfied” with the performance of Davao City Mayor Sara Duterte-Carpio. Vice Mayor Bernard Al-ag got 53.7 percent “very satisfied” and 22.5 percent “somewhat satisfied” performance rate as a government official. “This is an affirmation that we are effectively re...

content.title: フィリピンの性暴行祭壇男の子を非難した米司祭 -  ABC News
content.desc: Philippine immigration authorities have arrested an American Roman Catholic priest accused of sexually assaulting altar boys in a remote central town, in a case one official described as "shocking and appalling". Key points: - Reverend Kenneth Bernard Hendricks has lived in the Philippines for 37 years - A US court issued a warrant after complaints from Filipino minors - Each of the 50 counts of molestation is punishable for up to 30 years in prison Reverend Kenneth Bernard Hendricks, who has been indicted in Ohio for alleged illicit sexual conduct in the Philippines, was arrested in a chur...
